documents.document: @eoghanmcdermo @platinumjones pointed that out too â€“ I didn't know about that one. You 2FM know it alls
@Jenn__Crotty omg ARIANA GRANDE WASN'T BORN WHEN BEAUTY & THE BEAST CAME OUT! I am genuinely shocked
@platinumjones @aoiph ugh THIS WORLD.
@arshimbo just chipper! Back to being called a hoe by random strangers on Twitter so the world has been set to rights.
@aoiph um, I wasn't suggesting he try to fix any actions. But I think he could be a really powerful role model and spokesperson.
@aoiph I was reading about Zayn; I remembered how interested I was when he left 1D to see if he would become vocal re Islam. That's all.
@arshimbo oh, GROSS
And here I'd forgotten what it was like to make strangers angry on Twitter. I think it's been almost a week! https://t.co/73NLcL1BPO
@aoiph well, not up to you or I to say how anyone should be acting ever. But we're human. I find his silence disappointing â€“ it's an opinion
(Which, incidentally, is rubbish â€“ even though I am unashamedly excited about seeing the film.)
Even now, with Trump's Muslim ban causing outrage worldwide, he's too busy tweeting selfies and promoting his Fifty Shades Darker song.
When he left One Direction, I thought it would be really interesting to see what he did â€“ he had such potential to be such a strong voice.
Ah, just fondly remembering the time I thought Zayn â€“ the world's most famous Muslim man â€“ would actually try to make a difference.
On the wish list... I won't lie: I have been seriously smashed since before Christmas â€“ Decemberâ€¦ https://t.co/669FegCJD9
@GrangeWeb ha! As opposed to: "lose fat and gain muscle"
How to piss off a personal trainer: "I just want to lose weight and tone up." #irishfitfam
@jeannedesutun omg WHICH ONE
@DeeLightful77 they gave a statement to @colette_sexton for a feature last weekend saying all freebies must be declared and BIK paid
@icome_undone not to threaten you, but I'm going to bring my medium sized, bold dog to these places and BY GOD IF SHE'S REFUSED ENTRY ðŸ˜¡
I love Dublin at this time of day, when you're losing the light but you can still see â€“ when theâ€¦ https://t.co/qIfEilYgg7
In case you need to drop any Valentine's Day gifts-related hints... https://t.co/UeVtnkguBH
@ohfoley actually not quibbling about the car â€“ I have put that in my 2016 returns. More wondering about "everyday" freebies: gifts sent
@FacesByGrace omg when I saw your snap of us I was like, "who's that young boy?" IT WAS ME ðŸ˜±
@sherqui @irishstu @lav maybe it levels out? Still, BIK thing is impossible to monitor
@sherqui @irishstu @lav oh yes. Take your point! So if you pay your own way you can claim tax BACK; if you get a freebie you've to pay.
@sherqui @irishstu @lav but that's a separate issue imo.
@sherqui @irishstu @lav totally â€“ none of those reviews can be "honest", unless you pay your own way (and you're not recognised)
@sherqui @irishstu @lav no. Eg You can't make a foundation better for a reviewer. You can make a meal special: food, service etc.
@EmerTheScreamer @beatingblog omg same. And PR hay is like shavings from a lathe; you NEVER rid your home of it.
@irishstu @lav no, resto reviewers pay for their meals b/c they need to be relatively anon. Review isn't genuine if resto is treating you.
@beatingblog eg 9 times out of 10 you don't need a voucher / trip abroad / handbag / jo malone candle in order to do your job.
@beatingblog well then maybe the mag should foot the bill for items required to "do the job", no? And tbh most freebies are not essential
@irishstu @lav well, no, bc (I may regret saying this) I don't post re 90% of what I get. I don't work in exchange for product, basically.
@lav @adrianweckler but a "legit biz exchange" is a payment in kind, unless I'm mistaken? Eg, you could have a loan of a gadget for review.
@beatingblog oh THAT'S interesting. I guess the individual, unless the mag got to keep the loot?
@lav well, yes â€“ but beyond that, seems like a rule that never existed until Revenue made it up
@MsRachelMc as a writer i.e. artist, I think so. As a writer i.e. journo / blogger, it's the same as every other job.
And I mean ultimately, I don't want to break the law. So should I start returning everything I'm sent? Can I claim tax relief on postage?
I know I'm like a dog with a bone but (a) I think Revenue plucked this statement out of thin air & (b) I don't think anyone will ever comply
Also it'd be interesting to know U.K. policy. Do ppl like @CarolineHirons and @modelrecommends have to pay BIK tax on unsolicited freebies?
And if no one is paying BIK on their free tat, then hey, Revenue, this feels like an easy win! You've loads of money to collect!
Because surely if this is law â€“ and, according to Revenue, always has been â€“ then there are journos / bloggers out there adhering.
If I worked @thejournal_ie I'd be asking Revenue for a breakdown of BIK on free gifts collected from ALL media over the last 5 years.
I mostly want to know how you do it. Do you send things back? Surely we draw the line at paying BIK on things we don't want?
Journos / bloggers: I'd love to know if any of you are regularly declaring to Revenue and paying BIK on unsolicited freebies. Anyone?
@lizardschwartz I enjoyed the coil until my mooncup sucked it out. So I'd say: coil yay. Not in tandem with mooncup.

Now I, for one, would like to stop talking about this (working title: "The least important thing to happen in 2017 so far.") ðŸ˜‚

@jeannedesutun @colette_sexton well I'm really curious about motoring journos; I know several who don't own cars and drive freebies all year
@colette_sexton oh, er, I mean, I have the same policy *frantically deletes tweets* I'd say beauty journos are F*CKED most of all.
There's nothing like watching a video of yourself being booed to really put life into perspective ðŸ˜‚ #gossies2017 https://t.co/SulrdcPYD1
@colette_sexton but what I mean is â€“ as a journo, did you know this was (presumably always) the case? I never did!
@colette_sexton @sundaybusiness this is nuts. I presume it's not a *new* rule, so why's it been ignored up to now? And how is it enforced?
